vague_description: The city needs to allocate resources effectively for snow removal, balancing labor hours and budget constraints with varying worker contracts.
detailed_description: A city employs seasonal and permanent snow removers. A seasonal snow remover works \var{HoursSeasonal} hours per shift and gets paid \var{PaySeasonal}. A permanent snow remover works \var{HoursPermanent} hours per shift and gets paid \var{PayPermanent}. Currently the city needs \var{TotalHoursRequired} hours of snow remover labor after a heavy snowfall. If the city has a budget of \var{TotalBudget}, how many of each type of worker should be hired to minimize the total number of snow removers?
target_objective: Minimize the total number of snow removers
target_constraints: Seasonal snow removers work HoursSeasonal hours per shift
Permanent snow removers work HoursPermanent hours per shift
The city pays seasonal snow removers PaySeasonal per shift
The city pays permanent snow removers PayPermanent per shift
The city needs TotalHoursRequired hours of snow remover labor
The city has a budget of TotalBudget
Number of seasonal snow removers is an integer
Number of permanent snow removers is an integer
Number of seasonal snow removers is non-negative
Number of permanent snow removers is non-negative
Total hours worked by seasonal and permanent snow removers should meet or exceed TotalHoursRequired
Total budget spent on seasonal and permanent snow removers should not exceed TotalBudget
target_parameters: Number of hours a seasonal snow remover works per shift
Payment for a seasonal snow remover per shift
Number of hours a permanent snow remover works per shift
Payment for a permanent snow remover per shift
Total required labor hours for snow removal
